lines: ${spouseName} would like to invite some old friends from the other side of the country, Bill and Marsha, for a visit. Marsha is a sweet person (always HAS been). Bill is a competitive, materialistic so-and-so, who is tolerable in small doses,
but becomes very difficult to stand, VERY quickly.
${spouseName} has been hoping to see Marsha for quite some time, and would really be disappointed if you didn't extend an invitation for a few days. What will you do?
#ASK ${SPOUSENAME} TO UNDERSTAND WHY YOU DON'T WANT THEM OVER

Before they even step out of the car, you can hear Bill's big mouth, "HOWYA DOIN' THERE, OLD FELLA, GETTIN' A BIT OF A POT THERE!" (He pats your belly.) "YOU LOOK LIKE YOU'RE ABOUT TO DELIVER A LITTER OF PUPS HA! HA! A LITTER

After Bill and Marsha get settled in, Bill goes on to tell you about his boat, his new sports car, his portable video recorder and his local poker championship. "By the way, Scooter," (You don't know where he digs these
names up from.), "think you wanna mess with the old Grand Master, himself?"
On the first deal, you are dealt three kings, a jack and a deuce. He draws only one card. With a smirk on his face, he says, "Piece of cake, Buddy, PIECE OF CAKE."

You pick up a second jack. You now have a full house. Bill says, "You wouldn't care to make a little wager on the outcome of this hand, now would you sport? Let's say two grand, that is if you can AFFORD it!"

After much melodrama, Bill reveals his hand -- a full house, three queens and two jacks! "HA! HA! HA! CAN'T HUSTLE THE HUSTLER! THE CHAMP! THE KING OF KINGS! HA! HA!" You quietly turn over your cards, showing him your winning hand. He
turns white and says "Heh, heh. About that two thousand dollars, we were only kidding, right?"
#LET HIM OFF THE HOOK FOR THE $2000
You don't get the money, but you do get two thousand dollars worth of humility over the next few days which is well worth it!
He writes you out a check and promptly develops a mysterious illness (he says it's from your wife's cooking). He has to go back home early. P.S. the check bounces!

"HEY, NO BIGGIE. SOME OF US JUST CAN'T AFFORD TO PLAY WITH THE BIG BOYS, EH CHIEF?!" The time drags, but like all disasters, Bill and Marsha leave to plague some other unfortunates. ${spouseName} realizes what you have had to put up
with for the last few days and gives you the King's treatment until you recover.

Now why would you want to do a silly thing like that? You have passed up the opportunity for a full house. Bill wins the hand and proclaims another poker victory for The King of Cards, one of the many titles he has generously bestowed upon himself.

The time drags, but like all disasters, Bill and Marsha leave to plague some other unfortunates. ${spouseName} realizes what you have had to put up with for the last few days and gives you special treatment until you recover. You may be a bad
card player, but you are a considerate husband.
"But Marsha was my best friend in high school. It would be so nice if I could see her again."
${spouseName} decides to pick up and go visit them WITHOUT YOU.
